analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba chen po stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis na spros pa'i 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir ma dkrugs las zhes gsungs so //
translated: And because of that, it is said to be undisturbed, because of the absence of the disturbance of conceptual elaboration, due to the oneness of taste of great bliss and emptiness.

original: de ltar na nang gi skye mched nyid kyis na mig la sogs pa rnams las gtso bo nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi skye mched nyid kyis na mig la sogs pa rnams las gtso bo nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, because of being the internal sense bases, the eyes, etc., are the chief ones, and so the purities of the elements are taught.

original: 'byung ba la brten pa nyid kyis na gtso bo ma yin pa nyid kyis 'byung ba las gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin byang chub sems ma rnams te gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams rig par
analyzed: 'byung ba la brten pa nyid kyis na gtso bo ma yin pa nyid kyis 'byung ba las gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin byang chub sems ma rnams te gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams rig par
translated: And because of being based on the elements, the forms, etc., which are not the chief ones, are the purities of the external sense bases, the bodhisattva consorts, the goddesses such as R≈´pavajrƒÅ, etc.üîΩThis is to be understood.

original: bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma sogs drug / rdo rje bdag po can zhes bshad //üîΩthugs gsung sku yi rdo rje yis //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma sogs drug / rdo rje bdag po can zhes bshad // thugs gsung sku yi rdo rje yis //
translated: The six, beginning with Vajrarupa, are said to be the lords of the vajra.

original: bdag nyid che rnams yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: bdag nyid che rnams yang dag 'byung //
translated: The great beings arise from the vajra of mind, speech, and body.üîΩThe vajra is the Tathagatas, who are the lords of these, because they are the enjoyers.

original: zhes so // rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'di rnams kyi bdag po rnams te longs spyod pa po nyid kyis so zhes de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'di rnams kyi bdag po rnams te longs spyod pa po nyid kyis so zhes de ltar gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnam par dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'di rnams @167a * //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'di rnams @167a * //
translated: The nature of pure form, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi longs spyad bya bla na med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi longs spyad bya bla na med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar bstan to //
translated: is taught to be the very essence of the unsurpassed enjoyment of all the Tathagatas.

original: de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams gsungs so //
translated: Thus the Tathagatas, etc. are said to be the essence of the pure aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de las gzhan pa dpag tu med pa rnams kyang 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dpag tu med pa rnams kyang 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: And the immeasurable others should be understood in this way, etc.

original: de rnams thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa las tha mi dad pa rnams so zhes pas 'di rnams mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sgo can du 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa las tha mi dad pa rnams so zhes pas 'di rnams mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sgo can du 'grub pa'o //
translated: All of them are not different from the purification of the aggregates and so on. Thus, they are established as having Akshobhya and so on as their doors.

original: 'o na ci ltar mtha' yas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar mtha' yas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they infinite?

original: dpag tu med pa'i dbye ba can gyi phung po la sogs pa tha dad par zhen pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid dpag tu med pa'i tshul can rnams su 'di rnams 'char ba'i phyir ro
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i dbye ba can gyi phung po la sogs pa tha dad par zhen pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid dpag tu med pa'i tshul can rnams su 'di rnams 'char ba'i phyir ro
translated: Because they arise in the manner of being infinite, in the nature of the ma·πá·∏çala of the support and the supported, by the power of the thoughts of infinite sentient beings who conceive of the different aggregates and so on as being infinite.

original: // de ltar ni rten gyi dkyil 'khor ni de kho na nyid las rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: // de ltar ni rten gyi dkyil 'khor ni de kho na nyid las rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Thus, the ma·πá·∏çala of the support is awakening, which is completely pure of all aspects in reality.

original: byang chub de la gang rnam pa kun yongs su dag pa'i sems de ni nges pa'i don du na brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: byang chub de la gang rnam pa kun yongs su dag pa'i sems de ni nges pa'i don du na brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mind that is completely pure of all aspects in that awakening is, in terms of the definitive meaning, the ma·πá·∏çala of the supported.

original: de ltar ni 'di ni thun mong du lha'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'di ni thun mong du lha'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: Thus, this is the reality of the deity in general.

original: 'dir ni lha thams cad shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir ni lha thams cad shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rnams so //
translated: Here, all deities are of the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de la shes rab kyi de kho na nyid ni zab mo nyid do //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi de kho na nyid ni zab mo nyid do //
translated: There, the reality of wisdom is profundity.

original: de 'ang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'ang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that is due to the absence of conceptualization.

original: thabs kyi de kho na nyid na rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi de kho na nyid na rgya che ba ste /
translated: The reality of means is vastness.

original: de yang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that is due to mastery of the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba nyid de yang sems kho na'i dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba nyid de yang sems kho na'i dag pa'o //
translated: That mastery of the absence of conceptualization is the purity of mind alone.

original: de'i phyir sems kho na lta thams cad kyi bdag nyid du dang snga ma yang rgyas pa dang bcas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kho na lta thams cad kyi bdag nyid du dang snga ma yang rgyas pa dang bcas par bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, mind alone is the nature of all views, and the previous [verse] is explained with expansion.

original: de ltar yang lha'i sgo nas dang de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas sems rab tu rgyas par byed pa na 'bras bur gyur pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'thob kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang lha'i sgo nas dang de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas sems rab tu rgyas par byed pa na 'bras bur gyur pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'thob kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when the mind is expanded by way of the deity and by way of reality, one obtains the results, the qualities of a Buddha such as the perfections, but not otherwise.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa tsam bsgoms na 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin tsam 'thob ste rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa tsam bsgoms na 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin tsam 'thob ste rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched pa bzhin no //
translated: If one meditates on mere consciousness, one obtains mere worldly concentration, like the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci ste stong pa nyid tsam bsgom pa de'i tshe yang nyan thos bzhin @167b du mya ngan las 'das pa tsam gyi 'du shes can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste stong pa nyid tsam bsgom pa de'i tshe yang nyan thos bzhin @167b du mya ngan las 'das pa tsam gyi 'du shes can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And if one meditates on mere emptiness, then one would have the idea of mere nirvana, like the sravakas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su sbyong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su sbyong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would not be purifying the qualities of a Buddha.

original: ci ste yang lha'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig kho nar bsgoms na de lta na yang yongs su sbyang ba dman pa nyid kyi phyir de tsam gyis sangs rgyas nyid ma yin gyi dge bar ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang lha'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig kho nar bsgoms na de lta na yang yongs su sbyang ba dman pa nyid kyi phyir de tsam gyis sangs rgyas nyid ma yin gyi dge bar ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one meditates only on the deity, then because of the inferiority of the purification, one does not become a Buddha by that alone, but one does become virtuous.

original: ci ste stong pa nyid kyi ye shes bsgom gyi lha ma yin pa de lta na yang yun ring pos sangs rgyas nyid 'thob kyi myur du ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste stong pa nyid kyi ye shes bsgom gyi lha ma yin pa de lta na yang yun ring pos sangs rgyas nyid 'thob kyi myur du ma yin la /
translated: But if one meditates on the wisdom of emptiness, not on the deity, then one attains Buddhahood after a long time, not quickly.

original: gsum ka bsgom pa na ni shin tu dga' bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang byin rlabs kyi khyad par gyi phyir shin tu myur bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob bo //
analyzed: gsum ka bsgom pa na ni shin tu dga' bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang byin rlabs kyi khyad par gyi phyir shin tu myur bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob bo //
translated: But when one meditates on all three, one attains unsurpassable complete enlightenment very quickly, because of the great joy and because of the special blessing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa /
translated: For this very reason, it is said in the Vajra Tent of the Dakinis:

original: tha mal nga rgyal gzhom don du //
analyzed: tha mal nga rgyal gzhom don du //
translated: For the sake of destroying ordinary pride,

original: sgom pa yang dag rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: sgom pa yang dag rab tu bsgrags //
translated: meditation is proclaimed to be perfect.

original: zhes dang / slar yang 'on kyang mi gtsang ba'i lus sbyang ba'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi sku bsgom par bgyi'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes dang / slar yang 'on kyang mi gtsang ba'i lus sbyang ba'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi sku bsgom par bgyi'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúHowever, in order to purify the impure body, I will meditate on the Buddha‚Äôs body.‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa shin tu ba ma yin pa'i rnam par dag pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la gdul bya'i khyad par la dgongs nas rnam pa mang po gsungs te de 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa shin tu ba ma yin pa'i rnam par dag pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la gdul bya'i khyad par la dgongs nas rnam pa mang po gsungs te de 'dir ma spros so //
translated: The uncommon, very pure, is taught in many forms with regard to the special disciples of the creation stage, but I will not elaborate on that here.

original: rnam par dag pa'i snying po mdor bsdus pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab chen po la de rab tu spros pas ci bya /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i snying po mdor bsdus pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab chen po la de rab tu spros pas ci bya /
translated: What is the use of elaborating on that for those of great wisdom who follow the concise essence of purity?

original: shes rab chen po'i dbang du byas pa kho nar rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab chen po'i dbang du byas pa kho nar rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di bstan to //
translated: This king of tantras is taught only from the perspective of those of great wisdom.

original: de rab tu spros pa 'dod pa rnams rjes su gzung ba'i ched du rnam par dag pa rgyas pa dang bcas par bdag gis brjod do //
analyzed: de rab tu spros pa 'dod pa rnams rjes su gzung ba'i ched du rnam par dag pa rgyas pa dang bcas par bdag gis brjod do //
translated: I have explained it with extensive purity for the sake of those who wish to elaborate on it in order to guide them.

original: de la phyogs bcur rgyu ba'i bgegs kyi tshogs mi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i don du dbye bar byar med pa'i chos nyid rnam par dag pas rdo rje rab la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs bcur rgyu ba'i bgegs kyi tshogs mi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i don du dbye bar byar med pa'i chos nyid rnam par dag pas rdo rje rab la sogs pa'o //
translated: For the sake of preventing the hosts of obstructors who move about in the ten directions from entering, there are the vajra ground and so forth, which are the pure reality that is not to be divided.üîΩ

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes su shes pa dang kun rdzob dang yongs su 'dres pa shes pa zhes pa shes pa bcu rnam par dag pas 'khor lo'i rtsibs bcu pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes su shes pa dang kun rdzob dang yongs su 'dres pa shes pa zhes pa shes pa bcu rnam par dag pas 'khor lo'i rtsibs bcu pa'o //
translated: The ten spokes are the ten knowledges, such as the knowledge of suffering, origin, cessation, path, extinction, non-production, doctrine, subsequent doctrine, conventional, and knowledge of the knowable, which are purified.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga dang rnam par byang ba nyid kyi phung po lnga zhes pa bcu rnam par dag pas 'khor bo bcu rnams so //üîΩme long lta bu la sogs pa bcu rnam par dag pas 'khor lo'i lte ba @168a * //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga dang rnam par byang ba nyid kyi phung po lnga zhes pa bcu rnam par dag pas 'khor bo bcu rnams so // me long lta bu la sogs pa bcu rnam par dag pas 'khor lo'i lte ba @168a * //
translated: The ten rims are the ten purities, such as the five knowledges such as the mirror-like, etc., and the five aggregates of purification.

original: la gnas pa'i mgon po'o //
analyzed: la gnas pa'i mgon po'o //
translated: The center of the wheel is the Lord abiding there, who is the ten purities, such as the mirror-like, etc.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang sgra ji bzhin shes pa dag la yang ngo zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang sgra ji bzhin shes pa dag la yang ngo zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledge of the literal are also included.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pas mtha' yas pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor lor 'jug pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs dang chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pas mtha' yas pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor lor 'jug pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs dang chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are pure, the nature of space, the dharma-source is the seal of the various light rays that enter the wheel in the infinite directions and the source of the dharma.

original: sku gsung thugs rnam par dag pas de'i zur gsum ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rnam par dag pas de'i zur gsum ste /
translated: Since body, speech, and mind are pure, it has three corners.

original: dbus su skyon gyis mgos pa'i chos nyid rnam par dag pas 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma'o //
analyzed: dbus su skyon gyis mgos pa'i chos nyid rnam par dag pas 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma'o //
translated: Since the pure dharmatƒÅ in the center is unstained, there is a multicolored lotus.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na dbyer med pa'i ye shes lnga rnam par dag pas sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na dbyer med pa'i ye shes lnga rnam par dag pas sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: Since the nature of emptiness is indivisible, the five gnoses are pure, and there is a multicolored vajra.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'byed pa rnam par dag pas rva bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'byed pa rnam par dag pas rva bcu gnyis so //
translated: Since the twelve branches of dependent origination are pure, there are twelve spokes.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mtho ba nyi shu 'joms pa rnam par dag pas rva nyi shu pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mtho ba nyi shu 'joms pa rnam par dag pas rva nyi shu pa yang ngo //
translated: Since the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection are destroyed, there are twenty spokes.

original: de'i lte ba la byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Since the bodhicitta in the center is pure, there is a moon ma·πá·∏çala.

original: der rnam par snang mdzad rig ma dang bcas pa rnam par dag pas ye shes lnga rnam par dag pa'i kha dog lnga pa'i rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa thar pa chen po'i grong khyer gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: der rnam par snang mdzad rig ma dang bcas pa rnam par dag pas ye shes lnga rnam par dag pa'i kha dog lnga pa'i rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa thar pa chen po'i grong khyer gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: There, the palace of jewels of five colors, the color of the five pure pristine wisdoms, is the nature of the city of great liberation, with Vairochana and his consort in pure union.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang so so skye bo dag de kho na nyid du na gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mi mnyam pa med pa gsal bar byed pa rnam par dag pas dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par dag pas gru bzhi
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang so so skye bo dag de kho na nyid du na gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mi mnyam pa med pa gsal bar byed pa rnam par dag pas dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par dag pas gru bzhi
translated: It is square because of the purity of the four noble truths, and it is without any inequality because of the purity of the nature of nonduality between the transcendent and ordinary states.

original: pa'o // tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rnam par dag pas zur bzhi'o //
analyzed: pa'o // tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rnam par dag pas zur bzhi'o //
translated: It has four corners because of the purity of the four abodes of Brahma.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par dag pas shar gyi sgo'o //üîΩyang dag par spong ba bzhi rnam par dag pas lho'i sgo'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par dag pas shar gyi sgo'o // yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnam par dag pas lho'i sgo'o //
translated: It has an eastern gate because of the purity of the four establishments of mindfulness.üîΩIt has a southern gate because of the purity of the four right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnam par dag pas nub kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnam par dag pas nub kyi sgo'o //
translated: It has a western gate because of the purity of the four legs of manifestation.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga rnam par dag pas byang gi sgo'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga rnam par dag pas byang gi sgo'o //
translated: The five faculties of faith, etc., are the northern gate.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnam par dag pas sam stong pa dang mtshan med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du mi byed pa rnam par dag pas kyang sgo bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnam par dag pas sam stong pa dang mtshan med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du mi byed pa rnam par dag pas kyang sgo bzhi'o //
translated: The four means of gathering disciples are the four gates, or else emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the absence of fabrication are the four gates.

original: sgo nyid ni byang chub kyi thabs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo nyid ni byang chub kyi thabs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The gates are the very means of enlightenment.

original: dad pa la sogs pa stobs lnga rnam par dag pas tshon lnga'i rtsig pa rnams so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa stobs lnga rnam par dag pas tshon lnga'i rtsig pa rnams so //
translated: The five powers of faith, etc., are the five-colored walls.

original: rdzu 'phrul @168b gyi rkang pa bzhi rnam par dag pas sgo khyud rnams so zhes klu'i blo'i zhabs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul @168b gyi rkang pa bzhi rnam par dag pas sgo khyud rnams so zhes klu'i blo'i zhabs so //
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are the architraves, according to Nagamitra.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad rnam par dag pas sgo'i ka ba brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad rnam par dag pas sgo'i ka ba brgyad rnams so //
translated: The eight branches of the holy path are the eight pillars of the gates.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad kyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yan lag rnams ni ka ba rnam par dag pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad kyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yan lag rnams ni ka ba rnam par dag pa rnams so //
translated: The limbs are the pure pillars, because they are taught as all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de skad du yang klu'i blo'i zhabs kyis rnam par thar pa brgyad po ka bar 'gyur zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: de skad du yang klu'i blo'i zhabs kyis rnam par thar pa brgyad po ka bar 'gyur zhes gsungs nas /
translated: In the same way, the venerable Nagarjuna, after saying that the eight liberations are the pillars,

original: 'phags lam yan lag brgyad po nyid //üîΩka ba brgyad po zhes par bshad //
analyzed: 'phags lam yan lag brgyad po nyid // ka ba brgyad po zhes par bshad //
